concept.title: StylesFilter Plugin Extension
concept.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to dynamically modify the CSS styles used to render elements in the Author mode.

conbody.p: The plugin must extend the ro.sync.exml.plugin.author.css.filter.GeneralStylesFilterExtension class. This class has a callback on which you can alter the styles for an Author element.

This extension point is similar with the Styles Filter that you set at the Document Type level. The only difference is that the plugin filters styles are used for any opened XML document, regardless of the document type. The changes made by this plugin are prioritised over the changes made by the Document Type level filter.

p.note: Alternatively, you can instruct to use a custom CSS file for every XML document opened in Author mode.
